Elon made me angry so I developed a free "For You" Feed for Mastodon. It uses a very simple customizable algorithm that includes your feed but also top posts from multiple other instances. It favours accounts that were reblogged multiple times in your feed, or accounts you interacted with in the past.

Its still in early development, but if you are aware of the risks of trying out late night software you can try it here:
https://fedifeed.herokuapp.com

Also the code is here:
https://github.com/pkreissel/fedifeed/tree/main

title: Hypothesis: inflammatory acid-base disruption underpins Long Covid

last_post.content:
A mechanism for #LongCovid

I am beyond excited to finally be able to share what I’ve been working on for the past year.

At the beginning of March 22, I discovered a potential mechanism for #LongCovid. It was a unifying mechanism that could explain every single symptom that patients were reporting, something I never thought possible for a disease that has over 200. Yet, this mechanism actually did.

Link: https://www.frontiersin.org/articles/10.3389/fimmu.2023.1150105/full

title: The Dangerous Ideas of “Longtermism” and “Existential Risk” ❧ Current Affairs

last_post.content:
So let me get this straight.

The Effective Altruism/Musk/Thiel/MacAskill/Longtermism crowd is obsessed with artificial general intelligence.

Their view is that bringing about "friendly" AGI, along with space travel, should be humanity's top priority. They believe that if a “friendly” AGI superintelligence is created whose goals “are aligned” with “human goals,” then a new Utopian age will begin.

Their view is also that the biggest threat facing humanity is a malevolent AGI superintelligence, whose goals are not aligned with "human goals".

That's the dichotomy. Promote "friendly" superintelligence, avoid malevolent superintelligence.

Okay then.

Let's follow their logic.

Where would a socialist, feminist, or pro-Black superintelligence fit in that dichotomy?

If a superintelligence evaluated the data and decided that Emma Goldman and Comandante Che were basically right, and the best hope for humanity is to do away with all the billionaires, would that be a friendly superintelligence that's aligned with "human goals", or a malevolent one?

https://www.currentaffairs.org/2021/07/the-dangerous-ideas-of-longtermism-and-existential-risk @fediverse @technology

title: Is Substack Notes a ‘Twitter clone’? We asked CEO Chris Best

last_post.content:
This is one of the most comically disastrous social media CEO interviews I've ever read. Substack's morally vapid founders have determined that scrunching up their eyes, sticking their fingers in their ears, and yelling LALALALALA! is the ideal approach to content moderation.

The inexorable, gravitational lesson of every prior UGC platform is that a failure to have strong rules, stated clearly and enforced relentlessly, leads to a fetid swamp of toxicity.

Using {testthat} for the first time, and goodness was I glad to have that set up when I refactored the code for the main function in a package I’m developing 😎. title: The controversial article Matthew Kacsmaryk did not disclose to the Senate

last_post.content:
Judge who made new law out of thin air to ban the abortion pill deceived a lot of people on his way to becoming a judge, as the Washington Post reveals here: https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/2023/04/15/matthew-kacsmaryk-law-review/

The story quotes people who helped him by taking his name off an article that reinforced his absolutist anti-abortion beliefs. You can almost see them smirking as they lob what is almost surely pure BS to the news org, which regards itself as obliged to write it down and publish it.

This is a very insightful point from @melaniesill. Real-world events the NYT might otherwise frame as "Gay People in Florida Face Increasing Harassment" or "Florida Abortion Ban Leaves Women Desperate" are now exclusively presented as "DeSantis Seeks to Rally Evangelical Voters" or "DeSantis Leans Into his Anti-Woke Brand." Once you notice it it's everywhere, and it's completely toxic.

https://mastodon.social/@melaniesill/110198930247163451

title: History of Dr. Susan — Dr. Susan La Flesche Picotte Center

last_post.content:
After witnessing a white doctor refuse to treat a sick, elderly Native American woman who later died, Susan La Flesche Picotte decided to become a physician to help her people. Born in 1865, she grew up on Nebraska’s Omaha reservation.

In 1889, Picotte became the first female Native American to earn a medical degree in the U.S. She raised funding & opened Wathill Hospital in 1913 - the first private hospital on a reservation. https://drsusancenter.org/dr-susan #HistoryRemix #history #science

@david_colquhoun @lakens and if you want an object lesson in how important it is to think sensibly about priors you can read my recent blog https://samplingdistribution.blogspot.com/2023/04/fixing-really-ugly-model-post-script-to.html?m=1 where I explain (and correct) the poor choice of prior I had made in an earlier blog. It was only a toy model for illustration but the point still holds.

If you care at all about the details of how GPUs do precision, conversions, rasterisation, or any of the gory fine details, then download this now.

https://microsoft.github.io/DirectX-Specs/d3d/archive/D3D11_3_FunctionalSpec.htm

This is the DX11.3 spec, and it's basically the last full one-stop-shop functional spec Microsoft ever did - those docs are now diffused across lots of web pages.

It is also used as the basis of OGL and Vulkan, and indeed all current consumer GPUs. Yes its old, but the rules haven't changed much since then.

I was just playing a game of Asteroids,¹ and I can't stop thinking about how you are moving on the surface of a torus — exiting one side of the screen (e.g., top or left) and appearing on the other side (e.g., bottom or right). That's right, you're playing on a giant SPACE DONUT!
_____
¹ You can play here: https://scratch.mit.edu/projects/369684630/

title: Dave Winer - Developer response to Twitter cutoff

last_post.content:
Dave Winer writes about the Twitter API changes:

"Corporate platforms always fail, given enough time. The Twitter API had a good run. Now the deck is clear, and there’s room to make some new stuff, or just take a break and smell the roses a bit, or go for a bike ride. 🤪"

This seems like the right attitude to me too, even if it’s frustrating to deal with platforms failing. When one door closes, another opens.

title: News outlets, Twitter, and the fediverse

last_post.content:
German news website @heiseonline has been very active on the #fediverse, now the second largest news account. Editor @mho has extensively documented the process.

Findings compared to their (6x sized) Twitter account:

Way higher engagement than Twitter
Website traffic slightly below Twitter

Valuable information for any news organisation that is debating whether to leave Twitter, and which platform to join instead!

@fediversenews @spreadmastodon

Read it all at: https://fediversereport.com/news-outlets-twitter-and-the-fediverse/

I’ve written an open letter asking organisations that engage online with the blind community to come to Mastodon in light of the significant #accessibility regressions at Twitter.
If you agree, please sign it and share it as widely as you can. This is one occasion where if we can show how many of us care about this issue, it will make it clear that it’s worth companies putting in the effort to be here.
I would also be very grateful for the support of our sighted friends.
Thank you.
https://bit.ly/BlindMastodon

title: The fediverse is like social-media unionization for journalists

last_post.content:
This blogger gets it:

""Most importantly however: the fediverse is a movement, presently engaged in the woefully under-reported fight for an equitable and just internet, and it needs the champions...in its corner to stand a chance of winning.

This is no time for editorials and opinion pieces.

What we *civilians* need from you at this time is your attendance at the gathering space....

Grow the garden-like town square together with everyone else."

title: Minnesota Public Radio to quit Twitter

last_post.content:
It is a stampede:

"Minnesota Public Radio has joined the growing number of public radio stations that are quitting Twitter.

'After much discussion, we concluded that continued use of the social media platform Twitter by our organization was contrary to our mission and core values..Instead of being a neutral and efficient channel for serving the public, Twitter is now actively aiming to undermine the integrity of public media organizations like ours.'"

https://www.startribune.com/minnesota-public-radio-to-leave-twitter/600267335/

If you would like to contact American Public Media Group to nudge them to join the Fediverse, you can use this contact form:
https://cloud.connect.mpr.org/contact

FYI: APM Group is the parent of American Public Media and MPR, Minnesota Public Radio; which, is why you see MPR listed for the contact form.
